description: An inspection found there was a lack of substantive staff available to cover additional bed spaces.
title: Concern about staffing levels at Inverness' Raigmore Hospital
title_page: Concern about staffing levels at Inverness' Raigmore Hospital - BBC News
maintext:
Inspectors have told NHS Highland it must ensure enough staff are available to cope with patient needs in Raigmore Hospital in Inverness.
During an unannounced inspection in October, external the hospital was found to be above its patient capacity and additional beds were being used.
However, there was a lack of substantive staff available to look after the extra patients.
NHS Highland said an action plan had been developed to address areas identified for improvement.
The inspection team from Healthcare Improvement Scotland found the hospital was operating at 103% bed occupancy.
That was largely because of delays in discharging patients due to factors such as lack of space in nursing homes.
One ward area using additional beds had a vacancy rate of more than 40% for both registered nurses and healthcare support workers.
Supplementary staff were available but the inspectors said there were concerns that nursing teams were "struggling to meet fundamental care needs", such as timely medication administration and vital sign monitoring.
